article.title: KIC 2557430: A Triple System Containing One Gamma Dor and Two Flaring Components?

multiple_choice_question.text: What is shown in the upper panel of Figure 1?
choices: The entire light curves of KIC 2557430.
The light curves of KIC 2557430 during eclipses.
The maxima of the light curves to reveal variations out-of-eclipses.
The minima of the light curves to reveal variations during eclipses.

multiple_choice_question.text: What analysis method is used to obtain the normalized power-spectrums distribution shown in Figure 2?
choices: Phase Dispersion Minimization (PDM)
CLEANest
Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT)
Wilson-Devinney Code

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the red line in Figure 3 represent?
choices: The pre-whitened light curve data.
The observational data of the variation out-of-eclipses.
The synthetic light curve model derived from the obtained frequencies.
The residual variations associated with frequencies F1 and F4.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the reason for the change in shape of the residual light curve from Part 1 to Part 2 data in Figure 4?
choices: The presence of a third body.
Stellar cool spot activity and migration.
Stellar pulsation.
A combination of all three factors.

multiple_choice_question.text: What data is used to create the light curve analysis shown in Figure 5?
choices: The raw observational data.
The pre-whitened light curve data.
The residual light curve data.
The averaged detrended short cadence data.

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on its location in the HR diagram (Figure 6), what type of star is the primary component of KIC 2557430?
choices: δ Scuti star
γ Doradus star
Red dwarf
RS CVn binary

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the inverse parabolic variation of the (O-C)II residuals in Figure 7 indicate?
choices: Mass transfer from the primary to the secondary component.
Mass loss from the system due to flare activity.
Stellar spot activity on the primary component.
Presence of a third body.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the red lines in Figure 8 represent?
choices: The observed flare light curves.
The synthetic quiescent level of the light curve without flare events.
The OPEA model fit for the flares.
The residual variations after removing the flare activity.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the presence of two distinct OPEA models in Figure 9 indicate?
choices: All flares originate from the same star.
All flares are caused by the same physical mechanism.
Flares originate from two different sources with different (B-V) color indexes.
The OPEA model is not a good fit for the data.
